answers.answer: Hello,lump under foot is common in those who have allergies with shoes or shocks or those who are over weight.Other possible reasons may beCallus formation,Foot injury,Ganglion,Haematoma,Infection,Scar tissue, Sebaceous cyst etc.You can avoid shoes for few days and follow simple massage if it works.In case of no changes you should consult to a dermatologist.Hope it helps.Regards.

HiThanks for writing to the forum!Generally these types of swellings are callus formation. This occurs due to wrong pressure. Faulty foot wear—footwear not suiting your feet, wrong posture and prolonged standing cause this. This is called a “corn’ in general terms. Several adhesive caps are available which you can apply over them and which will remove these corns. Sometimes these cannot be removed easily and need surgical intervention. Diabetes too result in repetitive corns.Hope this helps. I think you should discuss these possibilities with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining

question: Why do I have two round, very painful lumps under each foot in the area of the solar plexus according to a reflexology foot chart?
title: feet
